When she woke up that morning, Silver was feeling hungry, and bloated.

Once she sat up, she noticed her belly had grown slightly over night. Lifting up her shirt, Silver placed a hand on her firm stomach. She was worried about her stomach, but first she wanted something to eat.

Heading down to the kitchen, she began to fry to some bacon and eggs. Her belly growled hungrily as the smell filled her nostrils. She patted her stomach. "We'll eat soon," she said to herself, but also unknowingly telling that to the alien in her tummy.

Once the food was cooked and she had her coffee, Silver sat on the couch in her lounge and ate breakfast. The TV played the morning news, although nothing too important was being reported. She finished the meal and set it on the coffee table.

Unbeknownst to her, the food was fueling the alien and giving it enough energy for another growth spurt soon...
1343112.title: She goes to sleep

13431122.content:
After cleaning the dishes, Silver decided to take a shower. The alien inside her steadily grew from the food that had been consumed. It grew slowly, the progress not yet noticeable by Silver.
She got into the shower, the water soothing against her skin. The alien, as it grew, developed small arms and legs, giving it the appearance of a large frog. It continued to grow in her, but Silver did not notice. She ran a hand over her slightly more distended belly, washing her body. Then, the growth became noticeable.
"Huh?" She watched in shock as her small belly grew, expanding to the size of a five month pregnant belly. "What the hell?" She pressed a hand against the taut swell, and stared down in confusion.
Silver felt a flutter and she paused. She backed out of the water, thinking maybe it was the water against her stomach. Then she felt it again, although stronger. Something pressed against her hand and Silver's eyes widened.
"I'm pregnant?!"
13431122.title: She takes a shower

choices: Crash site of the red one.
crash site of the white one.
1343121.content:
Silver long to see whats beyond the stars. Her favorite constellation the big dipper which lies long the ursa major. She always believed there is life somewhere out there and we're not alone. Lying on the back of her pick up truck.. she does thing she loves most.. which was stargazing. Silver could forget all her problems as she looked at the stars.

Silver worked with her father at the large observatory the top of the hill which was outside the city they lived in. Her mother was a plain housewife while she had two siblings, Stephen who was 16 and Sarah who was 12. Silver had always been a smart girl. Studing astrology at the nearby university than some big time though accepted she decided no to since she wanted to be close to home... and she couldn't stargaze with the big telescope her dad uses. She gazed at the big dipper.

"There are theories that there us life where the big dipper is. I hope i'm the first to discover it." Silver thought to herself. Just then she saw two meteors from the sky.

"This is quite rare. Defense should've shot them down." Silver thought. One was dark red whilebthe other was bright white. The dark red crashed into the nearby city as the white crashed in the nearby field.

"Oh wow! Those will fetch a bundle. Maybe they might be some aliens!" As Silver jumped from her truck to the driver's seat and made her way too...
1343121.title: The being from the big dipper

choices: Silver wakes up the next morning.
The alien reveals more about itself during the night.
13431211.content:
Silver figured that she could always check out the crash site of the white meteorite on the return trip home anyways. So she headed towards the city.

Besides, she thought to herself, a white light I can understand, but a dark red... She shook her head and looked back up at the road.

After ten minutes of driving she finally reached the city limits, and curiously despite it being relatively late at night, Silver would have thought that people would have least heard the meteor impact the ground or feel a quake of some sort.

As she was about to pull into the city itself, noticed a cluster of red dust forming to her left.

"Bingo!" She grinned, eagerly rotating the steering wheel as she frantically parked her vehicle.

"This must be cosmic dust of some sort," she mused, "I must be getting close if it's this thick." As she walked onward the red dust started dissipating more and more until she finally stood in a clearing where a visible trail of dirt denoted that something had landed in the immediate area.

"Strange..." Silver muttered, "there is evidence that the meteor must have crashed here, but the only thing left is all that dust..." Suddenly she heard the snap of a twig behind her. Silver quickly whipped around as she saw a flash of red jump at her.

Luckily, Silver managed to dodge to the side as the entity flew past her and ended up tumbling to the ground. As it landed on the ground in a heap Silver heard it let out a hiss of sorts before it sneakily tried to get up.

"Agh! Stupid...human!" It growled to itself before wearily turning towards Silver.

While Silver could tell that this creature was certainly not of Earth, she noticed that aside from its skin tone and eye color, both of which were a blood red, it bore a striking resemblance to a human infant in terms of looks.

"Y-you're...an extraterrestrial life form!" Silver breathed.

"Yeah, and your point?" The creature growled back, narrowing its eyes in defiance, "if you're planning to take me home as some sort of trophy then you can bet I won't make it easy!"

Silver about to respond, noticed that the red alien was breathing quite heavily and looked as if it had sustained multiple scrapes and bruises all across its body.

"Are you...injured from the crash?" Silver asked sweetly.

"Yeah, and if I wasn't, I could easily take on a lower life form like you!" It shot back.

"Well that's a bit rude," Silver pouted, "I'm offering you help here!"

"Yeah well forgive me if I'm not so trusting of strangers from other planets." The creature growled, rolling eyes, "for all I know your 'help' could mean bringing me back to a lab and dissecting me."

"What? Absolutely not! That's horrible!" Silver cried, appalled at the notion of such a thing. "I simply see that you are quite injured and want to help you!"

The creature paused and looked over Silver, who held her breath as its eyes studied her intensely, likely looking for any signs of dishonesty that she could be displaying.

After what seemed like an eternity, the creature sighed and hung its head before looking up at her.

"Alright fine," it conceded, "I'll accept your aid, but don't get me wrong, the second I recover I'm gone!"

"Alright fair enough!" Silver said passively, inwardly holding back her glee at the creature's acceptance. "Let's head back to my vehicle and I can let you ride in it!

"No need." The creature stated, "I've got a better idea!"

"What do you mean?" Silver asked, her look of confusion turning to shock as she saw the creature transform into a translucent red orb and float towards her within a few seconds.

"Alright hold still, this will only take a second." The creature declared.

"Hey wait-" Silver tried to protest before the orb entered her body, making her shudder as a warm feeling ignited within her. She couldn't place why, but she suddenly felt far more...aware of her surroundings than she previously had.

Alright, let's get moving human! Silver jumped at the sudden declaration as she frantically looked around for the owner of the voice. "Relax! It's just me communicating through your thoughts, man you humans are so high strung!"

"Well excuse ME for not dealing with extraterrestrial beings on a daily basis!" Silver huffed in annoyance before starting to head back to where her truck was located.

However, as she turned to walk away, she heard the sound of air being parted, as if something had been thrown, before a pure white blade embedded itself directly in front of her.

Silver gasped as she turned to face her assailant, only to find that the blade belonged to another alien. However, this one seemed to be the size of a fully grown adult, with the difference being that its skin and eyes were comprised of a pure white tone similar to that of the blade.

"Halt human, I am afraid I can allow you to go no further!" It called out to Silver with a hostile glare.

Crap! She heard the creature nervously curse in her head, didn't think he'd find me so quickly!

"W-who are you?" Silver shakily inquired as the alien formed another blade in its hands.

"My name does not matter, little human." The being replied evenly, "what matters is that the being you aided must die."

"I...I can't let you do that, I'm afraid." Silver gulped anxiously, "I promised to help them, and I won't betray them."

"I do not wish to kill an innocent life form, but if you stand in my way you shall be destroyed." It warned.

Human, I can't believe I'm saying this, but you are gonna have to fight him. Silver heard the red alien sigh.

But how?!? She cried, beads of sweat beginning to form as she saw that the white alien was beginning to lose its patience. This guy is in a league of his own, and the only fighting I've done was in the kendo club in school!

I know, and if it wasn't for the fact that he's injured from the crash like me I wouldn't even be suggesting what I'm about to say. The alien growled in frustration.

And that is?

I can give you some of my power to fight this guy, but... the alien trailed off. Even with what little power I can give you, It could make your mind very...unstable.

"Enough stalling! Last chance human, will you relinquish my enemy, or will I have to destroy you both?" The white alien declared to Silver, who snapped out of her thoughts and looked back towards her aggressor with gritted teeth.

"Alright, do it." Silver muttered to herself. As soon as the affirmation left her mouth she felt the feeling of warmth return from earlier as she felt it intensify more and more into pure burning sensation that engulfed her body as she emitted a blinding red light that forced the white alien to cover its eyes.

"Human! You are making an egriegous error!" It shouted to her. However, Silver paid no attention to its threat as the burning feeling finally settled and the red light faded.

She looked down at herself to see that her clothes had been replaced with a set of red armor that reminded her of a knight's steel plating from the medieval era. In her left hand she held a broad axe, but contrary to its size, it felt almost weightless in her hand.

The other thing she noted was that she felt as though her muscles had become much stronger and had much more energy to spare than she'd ever recalled before.

Human? she heard the alien call to her, you alright? How do you feel?

Silver opened her mouth to say something, when a feeling of something that could only be described as a pure rage engulfed her thoughts. Her face twisted into a snarl as she eyed her opponent and brandished her axe towards it.

"I feel like I want to tear this guy apart!" She growled in a lower, more threatening tone than she'd ever heard from herself. "But otherwise...I feel...amazing!" She finished, a manic grin washing over her face.

Huh, I'm impressed, not many species out there can handle my kind's innate level of bloodlust without going insane! Unless you're just a special sort of human? The alien chuckled.

"Probably the latter," Silver chuckled darkly, before flashing her opponent a predatory grin, "though if you don't mind I'd like to shut up and beat this guy to a bloody pulp with this axe."

"If you are so eager to fight, then come at me human." The white alien calmly stated, before taking its previous stance of aggression.

"In that case...hehe..." Silver giggled madly, "time break this thing in!" No sooner had the words left her mouth when she leapt towards her opponent at an inhuman speed and brought her axe down all too eagerly.

Axe met blade in a clash as Silver furiously swung her axe in a frenzy at the white alien, who grunted as it deflected each blow. Finally, Silver's relentless onslaught managed to pierce the defense and connected a blow as she tore a gash in the alien's side, who jumped back as it yelled in pain.

"You...human..." it said, stumbling back in shock, "I will not let it end like this the next time!"

Silver growled and leapt once more at her foe, but was met with thin air as the being teleported out of her sight.

"Coward, next time you won't be walking away..." She hissed, before a feeling of nausea and dizziness made her fall over. "Crap, guess I pushed myself too hard...." she groaned, before she faded from consciouness.

Guess I'd better get her out of here. The alien sighed as he teleported Silver into the driver's seat of her truck. She can rest here until the morning. Still...who could have thought that a human would bond so well with me... The alien hummed to itself, before falling asleep itself.

Later...
13431211.title: Crash site of the red one.

134312111.content:
Sore... Silver groaned internally as she started to come to. Why am I so sore? As her eyes fluttered open, she instantly regretted the action as she received a face full of sunlight. Shakily holding an arm to cover her eyes, she blearily scanned her surroundings. In addition to the soreness, she noted that she felt oddly heavy and lethargic for some reason, but couldn't quite place why.

"The truck?" She muttered, "why am I-" She froze, the memories of the previous evening flooding back. "Oh god, the meteor!" She sprung into action, her hand instinctively reaching to unbuckle the seatbelt, but halted immediately as her hand lightly brushed her stomach at a distance much further out than it should have.

"What the HELL!" She shrieked, finally figuring out why she'd felt so much heavier as she stared down what looked to be a belly that protruded out from her and looked big enough to be in month 9 of a pregnancy and approaching full term shortly. Poking it lightly with a finger, as if it were some foreign entity and not her own torso, she pulled her shirt up enough to reveal pale expanse of skin underneath. Timidly placing a hand on the mound, her mind slowly started coming to term with the discovery. "Okay...calm down Silver...breathe for a moment...nothing to get too worried about, you're just inexplicably pregnant with no idea who the father is." She shakily reassured herself. Just how am I supposed to explain this to ma and pa? They're gonna be furious!

I wouldn't worry about it too much human? A voice spoke to her suddenly, making her jump at the sudden intrusion of her thoughts.

Who the- wait...I recognize your voice! Silver recalled in surprise, you're that alien from yesterday.

Guilty as charged. The alien retorted, though I'm willing to bet you have a lot of questions for me.

Naturally, and I suppose you're responsible for... my current condition?

You mean getting you knocked up? The alien chuckled, making Silver frown at her anxiety not being taken seriously. The alien, noticing her distressed thoughts, sighed and adopted a more matter of fact tone. Look human, like I said, relax for a bit, I'll explain mostly everything to you now, and if you have any questions you can ask me after I'm done.

Fine... Silver sighed, fishing out the keys from her pocket and starting the truck, giving the gas a few presses to make sure the vehicle was revved up and ready to go. Talk to me while I drive I suppose.

Well okay, to start off with some good news for you.

Oh? Do tell.

Well for starters you won't have to worry about giving birth or anything like that since you're not pregnant in the conventional sense.

"Could have fooled me with this." Silver growled, patting her belly for emphasis.

Geez, here I thought you were a bit more mild-mannered...anyways, I know it may seem like you are pregnant, but a couple of species out there in the galaxy, when injured, revert to a more defensive form like the orb that I turned into when I bonded with you yesterday.

"Makes sense I guess, you were pretty injured when I found yo- HEY! Look at the road you neanderthal!" Silver shouted, mashing her horn as a car cut across her lane without warning. "God, I'm usually not this irritable." She huffed through clenched her teeth.

That actually brings me to my next point. That irritability is a temporary side effect of my bond with you. My species as a whole is naturally prone to a bit of bloodlust and a thirst for battle, and so any hosts we bond with usually experience these kinds of symptoms.

"That's true, I do remember flying off the handle yesterday when you formed that armor on me." Silver hummed.

That surprised me as well, the alien chuckled, but it's a sign of a host with potential, because the more compatible a host is, the stronger our bond is, and the more our emotions are linked and affected by one another.

"Interesting, anything else I should know before we arrive home since we're about to pull up."

Well, just a couple more things, most importantly on your end as an added means of survival I can alter others' perception of you so that you appear normally to everyone else.

"Well that at least takes care of having to hide from my parents." Silver cheered with a relieved smile.

The final thing, is that in my current state I'm healing back to my former self. so it could be a while before I get out of your hair.

"Well, considering you've taken care of most of the inconveniences, I can't really be mad I guess." Silver sighed, before getting out of her truck and heading towards the front porch of her house. As she drew nearer, a black Labrador perked up and craned its neck to look around. As the dog spotted Silver, its tail began to wag as the canine leaped up before running over, letting out a few barks in excitement.

"Hey boy!" Silver cooed, "how's our little Chief doing today?" The dog responded to the affectionate words by leaping up and placing its paws on Silver's stomach, Silver crying out in surprise, only to pause as it the appendages meet a solid surface a lot sooner than expected. Curious at this event, Chief paused, tilting his head in confusion before sniffing the area underneath his paws. The moist feeling of her dog's nose made Silver shiver at the weird sensation until Chief had finished his investigation. As if shrugging, Chief simply let out a snort before heading back over to his spot on the porch.

"I thought no one could see my pregnancy?" Silver hissed at the alien, now worried that her parents would discover their daughter in a very compromising position.

I said I could alter other people's perception, not pets. The alien reminded her.

"Oh...right, sorry." Silver sheepishly grinned as she opened the front door and headed inside. "Ma, Pa, I'm home!" She called out as she entered the living room and sat in a heap on the couch.

"Over here sweetie!" Silver heard her mom call from behind her. Turning her head, Silver saw her mother, Lisa, approaching with a plate of scrambled eggs and pancakes in hand. "And where were you last night young lady? Your father and I were worried sick when you didn't come home all night."

"U-Uh...well I saw a couple of shooting stars and wanted to investigate." Silver sputtered out hastily, "I-I kinda lost track of time and ended up falling asleep in the truck." Her mom hummed and gave her a scrutinizing glare, searching for signs of a lie for the briefest of moments, before sighing in resignation.

"Well you never could stop yourself from studying the night sky, just be careful next time alright?" Her mother chided with a pat to Silver's head, "plus you have classes tomorrow so don't pull this again too often."

"Yes ma'am." Silver responded, before digging in to her breakfast. She hadn't actually thought about how hungry she'd been until her first plate of food came, then her second, and then her third...

"Ooooh..." Silver groaned, massaging her belly as she let out a burp, "I -urp- can't believe I ate so much..." suffice to say, after four plates of her mother's cooking, Silver having to be helped to her room and onto her bed was an expected outcome.

Heh, sorry kiddo, she heard the alien chuckle, I didn't wanna be a parasite and leech all your nutrients from you so I had you eat a little extra.

"Well, at least you're being honest about it." Silver yawned. "Say, I never did get your name by the way."

Well considering my name doesn't really have a pronunciation in your tongue, you can just stick with calling me Crimson for now.

"Crimson...that's a good name I think."

Glad I have your approval. The alien chuckled teasingly.

"Easy, I could just as easily let you back out on your own." Silver growled playfully, sticking her tongue out in response to the jab.

You don't know how to do that. The alien pointed out.

"Well I- whatever! I'm taking a nap!" Silver declared in defeat before turning to her side and pulling the covers over her.

As day turned to night Silver eventually woke up and came down for dinner, where she greeted her dad and explained where she'd been the previous evening. Though he was a bit mad at first at, he was happy that she'd arrived back home safe and sound. Luckily, neither of her parents pressed the details, and true to Crimson's word neither of them had noticed anything different about her, and after eating a hearty meal and helping wash the dishes Silver headed back to her room for the night.

So you got school tomorrow eh kid? Crimson questioned.

"Yup, every week for the next few months until summer break." Silver told him as she changed into her sleep-wear. With a yawn she turned out the lights and got into her bed. "Man I'm not gonna be this tired everyday right?"

Not really, but since I knew today wouldn't be too strenuous I used a little more energy than usual to heal up. Crimson explained.

"Well, I don't mind this time but run that by me next time you do that, I don't wanna fall asleep in the middle of class or anything."

Got it, good night kid.

"Night," Silver whispered, looking down at her protruding belly and placing a hand on it before looking to her window. The stars twinkling in the sky made her wonder what was to come, and where the other alien she'd encountered was.

Guess I'll cross that bridge when I come to it. She thought as she drifted off to sleep.
134312111.title: A Startling Discovery

choices: Follow Vanessa and confront her about her pregnancy...
Stay put and lay low, no need to rush...
1343121111.content:
Geez, after seeing this debacle I'm glad my species figured out space travel. Crimson said from within Silver's mind.

"Not helping." Silver testily grunted. Fighting the urge to slam on her horn in frustration, Silver instead began tapping her foot impatiently. The source of her current frustration was a traffic jam that had occurred on the main road she normally took to school. She noted that several lanes had been allegedly closed off due to construction that had been declared overnight. "I wonder if the meteor could have been the reason for this..."

Possibly, Crimson replied disinterestedly, though after we left yesterday the only thing any other humans will find will be nothing but a couple of barren rocks and dirt, after all, we don't need any native species interfering on missions if they aren't quite space-worthy.

"Speaking of which..." Silver said, furrowing her brows, "what is your mission here? All I've gotten out of this so far is a late night, a lot of extra weight, and an alien that we don't know the location of."

Well... Crimson hesitated, knowing that mission critical information shouldn't be revealed, even to his host, I'm not authorized to give you the long version... Silver growled frustratedly in response, her blood pressure rising almost instinctively, but I can tell you that my target is the being you fought before.

"What did he do?" Silver questioned, relaxing slightly from the information, however minuscule it had been. "I'm assuming it had to be something pretty bad if he's got some bounty on his head."

Also classified unfortunately, Crimson replied, shutting down that line of conversation, sorry kiddo, but I just can't tell you too much about mission related data.

"Well what can I know about?" Silver asked as she ran a hand through her dark ebony locks. It was definitely annoying that she was being left in the dark by a creature who at this point was basically using her as a glorified incubator.

Well, considering we'll have to fight that other guy sooner or later, I'll teach you how to utilize me in battle and control your bloodlust during fights a bit easier two. It'll help you keep cool, and help me get more acclimated with your body as well. Sound good? Crimson offered, trying to cheer the girl up.

"Honestly...yeah, that sounds pretty awesome actually!" Silver replied, allowing herself a small smile despite a tiny ember of annoyance remaining within her. "I guess we can do that back home in the shed so we don't scare Ma or Pa."

HONK! The loud blaring of a horn behind her snapped Silver into focusing on the more important task at hand.

"Okay okay I'm going..." Silver muttered, a blush growing in her cheeks out of embarrassment. Stepping on the gas pedal, she once continued on her journey to her campus until finally arriving in the parking. Fortunately, as bad as the traffic getting to the school was, she managed to quickly find a parking spot and planted herself in it without hesitation.

"Good to be back at college after Spring Break," Silver sighed in contentment, equipping her backpack and walking away from her car after making sure to lock it. "Good thing they let freshman own cars, otherwise riding the bus here would be the worst."

So what's on the agenda here? Crimson wondered, hope it doesn't take too much time, we really need to be looking out for that other guy.

"Well for one, not going to school would raise some suspicion amongst my teachers, and we wouldn't want that." Silver pointed out, "also since you're probably going to head out once your mission is over I don't want to screw over my education in the long run."

Fair enough I suppose, Crimson relented with an impatient huff, I guess while you're taking care of your classes here I'll keep thinking of a way to track down the target.

"Sounds good, I only go til' the early afternoon today so that leaves us plenty of time afterwards." Silver agreed, pushing open a door to the building she'd been heading towards. "Ah, the science building, how I've missed you!"

Neeeeeerd... Crimson chuckled, before receding back into Silver's mind to begin planning.

I'm gonna get him back for these verbal jabs one of these days... Silver vowed as she planted herself in one of the seats. She was a little early to her chemistry class, but she knew firsthand that even though the lecture hall was huge enough to seat over 200 people that once all of the class arrived finding a seat was highly unlikely, at least if you wanted any good place to sit at. Normally she was one of the student's who liked to sit at the front row, but since she was dealing with a bit bigger...circumstances currently she figured she would sit a couple rows back, even though no one would be able to spot any differences in her figure.

At about two minutes before class started a mass of students trudged in, as Silver expected them to, and seats quickly filled up. Shortly thereafter the professor made their entrance and went through the schedule for the rest of the year. The class went by normally, Silver dutifully took notes and nothing new came on the agenda except for a test in a couple of weeks.

After the professor dismissed the lecture Silver perked up as her next class wasn't too far from her current location.

"Finally, I get to hear more Astronomy lectures!" She cheered, pumping her fist in anticipation. Unlike the chemistry hall, the room for astronomy took place in a planetarium or observatory every other day, but since it was the first day back from spring break it would be in the normal lecture hall. Silver took her seat in the middle rows this time, as she knew it held the best view for anything the professor put on the projector, and was still a good spot to hear the lecture since the room was designed for about 40-50 students and was a lot closer together because of that.

Upon sitting down however, Silver felt an odd feeling of anxiety wash over her, making her shudder involuntarily. Frowning, she scanned the room, looking for anything out of the ordinary, until she looked at the front of the room.

Is that...Vanessa? Silver's eyes widened as her emerald orbs made contact with a pair of chocolate ones from across the room. Vanessa, as Silver remembered, was a junior who was a teaching assistant for a few of the entry level astronomy major courses for freshman, and so she'd seen her around somewhat frequently. With golden blonde hair and a figure that many guys found themselves getting shot down for, Silver often found herself envying the girl's outgoing and friendly nature, especially since Silver was much more reserved and hardly knew anyone on campus. There was one thing that caught Silver's attention as she exchanged a shy wave to the other girl.

She looked about 9 months pregnant.

Crimson! Silver hissed in her mind, Crimson! There's something I need to ask you about quic-

You're thinking the same thing then huh? Crimson cut her off with a serious tone, that girl wasn't pregnant before you left for your break was she?

Not in the slightest, Silver affirmed, before pausing, you don't think...

Only one way to find out kid...we have to confront her. Either after this class or later if you don't feel prepared now, but I'd say the sooner we get it out of the way the better.

Hm... Silver thought to herself, but before she could reach a decision the Professor, Mr. Inarya, had already begun the lecture.

Normally, Silver would have participated in the lecture by asking questions and taking detailed notes throughout the lesson, however, her mind was still deliberating on how to handle the situation with Vanessa, and before she knew it class was already letting out.

Well kid, what are you gonna do?

I... Silver paused, looking at the entrance of the room to see Vanessa walking into the hallway and turning around the corner. She knew she had to make a decision quickly.

After a second of thought she decided to...
1343121111.title: Class In Session

choices: We are no longer able to change people's perceptions of you...
Anyone who sees you, think's your pregnancy is normal...
You've accidentally called for an invasion, on an apocalyptic scale...
13431211111.content:
Soon after class let out, Silver marched up to Vanessa, and grabbed her hand, pulling her out of the room.
"We need to talk." Silver stated, as she dragged Vanessa to a secluded location of the campus, where it was impossible for any security cameras to spy on them due to the poor angle.
"What's up Silver?" Vanessa asked standing across from her friend. "You're looking great by the way."
"Same with you. The pregnancy look suits you." Silver stated. "I know you weren't pregnant when Spring Break started, and I know you didn't have that belly when I spoke to you last week at the star-gazing festival we went to, to watch the meteor shower."
"I could say the same about you." Vanessa said, getting defensive.
"I'm not trying to judge you or anything, but I just want to know, did you take in a white glowing orb a couple nights ago, and suddenly wake up the next morning to find yourself pregnant?" Silver questioned, rubbing her own belly.
'Silver, what are you doing? Don't be so direct with the question.' Crimson nearly shouted in her head.
"Yeah actually. She was injured, and needed a place to heal, so I became her host, or surrogate mother, you could say." Vanessa stated, rubbing her belly, feeling movement from her tenant.
"She? When I encountered it, I didn't see anything that identified it as a female, it didn't even sound female." Silver stated.
"She says that's a side effect of the armor she wore. Even the helmet she wore made her sound like a male. They don't really do anything good for the female warriors besides, help them with weight loss, due to how heavy the armor is." Vanessa stated. "She says your the host of the red being, and that you attacked her."
"She attacked me first." Silver sighed. "I helped Crimson because he was injured. But she suddenly started to attack me, so Crimson let me use his power to defend myself."
"I see." Vanessa said, getting closer to Silver. "So, you've still got that big heart of yours. Despite having the bloodlust of a red, inside you." Vanessa stated, their bellies now touching.
"V-Vanessa that's a little too close." Silver said blushing, her heart pounding.
'Silver calm yourself, I can hear and feel your heart pounding like a drum.' Crimson stated.
'I can't help it. I'm bi-sexual, and I have an immense crush on Vanessa. Having her this close to me with our bellies touching is almost a dream come true.' Silver cried out mentally.
"Silver, I got a question for you." Vanessa smiled, their breasts pressing together as she leaned in closer to Silver. "Would you like to try and help the two aliens try and resolve whatever they're at war for?"
"Stop a war?" Silver asked, feeling dizzy from how close Vanessa's lips were to hers. "I mean, I would certainly be up to try and come up with a peaceful solution to end the fighting between the two races we carry now. I honestly do like it when I'm in my red form, it makes me feel more confident about myself, but I'm also scared of losing myself to the bloodlust."
"Then let's fix that." Vanessa smiled, kissing Silver on the lips.
The kiss took Silver by surprise as she wasn't prepared for his. When Vanessa broke the kiss, after what felt like forever, which was only five minutes of kissing, Silver's face looked a little dreamy as she had a fantasy of hers come true.
'Hello Silver, we meet again.' A feminine voice rang in her head.
"Who said that?" Silver asked looking around.

14111.content:
...before a wave of hunger hit her.

Before she could even stop herself, she made her way to the barely-used kitchen. The room was pristine and glamorous like the rest of the Bennett mansion. Ultra modern gadgets were sprinkled throughout the large room that could easily work for a large family, and not for just Rose and her parents - not that she saw her parents much as it was.

Rose's father was constantly travelling for business, coming home for only a few days at a time before heading off to another state or country to do business with royalties and politicians all over the world. No one really knew what type of business he did, but there had been gossip going round for a number of years about affairs and secret families. Rose knew not to ask, merely shaking off the comments of some of her father's apparent scorned lovers when they turned up at the house demanding money and answers.

Her mother on the other hand, did not always take it well. She was only 19 when she'd met Rose's father, who was almost ten years her senior. As soon as the divorce from his first wife came through they'd had a lavish wedding at seven months pregnant with Rose. She'd hated her life since the day they'd said 'I do' feeling trapped in a loveless marriage, but too afraid to leave him after signing a strict prenup. Much like her husband, she'd had a number of affairs throughout Rose's life, all crashing and burning as quickly as they'd started.

Their relationship was one of the reasons she'd sworn off commitment.

Although the Bennett ladies rarely cooked in the kitchen, it was always fully stocked to keep up appearances for the few dinner parties and afternoon teas that her mother hosted. She'd never cooked, always bringing staff in to cater for her friends and passing it off as her own. A few martini's in, she'd confess to not cooking anything.

Rose opened the pantry, pulling out all the 'off-limits' foods that her mother used to keep for her the days after her break-ups where she'd stuff herself silly with grief. She'd gain 10 pounds and then work out like crazy for a month, or get liposuction. Rose swore to never let food take control of her life and had, up until this point, eaten what her nutritionist made her, or simply brought premade salads or low-carb meals, not caring for the taste of food so she could keep her killer bod.

Today, however, she had actually felt a real hunger for the first time.

In no less than an hour, Rose had devoured three pound cakes and some twinkies, washing it down with a 2L bottle of cola. She lay on the cool floor of the pantry groaning as she stroked her swollen belly, surrounded by wrappers. The hunger had gone, but the haze in her head crept over her more.

Here eyes fluttered, exhaustion coming over her as she slowly passed out.

As she lay there, the first slight changes came over her body. A soft layer of fat developed over her midsection as her breasts gained a little more padding. Her hips spread out a little wider, her thighs growing with it. The

A few hours later, Rose woke up.

Her light head had gone, replaced with nausea.

She barely had time to get to one of the many bathrooms in the house before she heaved. When she was finally done, one hand moved the bedraggled strands of hair from her face while the other came to rest on her tight stomach. She looked down at it, not caring about the slight softness as she'd never been athletic, focusing more on the face it curved out slightly and felt rock hard.

"Huh. I must be really bloated today." She shrugged it off, suddenly feeling tired again.

She made her way back up to her boudoir and curled up under the covers, not noticing the cursive note that had appeared on her dresser as she slowly drifted off to sleep.

14112.content:
Back in her room, Rose suddenly felt a little light headed. She sat down on the edge of the bed for a moment before a sharp pain went across her abdomen.

Then everything went black.

When Rose awoke, she felt heavy, like she was being weighed down by something. She slowly opened her eyes and tried to manoeuver herself into a sitting position, but she was struggling, breathing heavily even after a few moments. Confusion briefly swept over her, wondering how she'd got into bed and why she seemed to be wearing pajamas in bed when she always wore her 'birthday suit' to bed.

Sweat dripped down her forehead as she finally managed to get into an upright position, and that's when she noticed that the weight that she felt was actually her.

Well, her belly to be more precise.

Rose stared at it wide-eyed as shock came over her. The round dome was straining against the buttons of her tatty sleep shirt, something she'd never dream of being caught in. She looked around the room in panic. Something isn't right.

This wasn't her bedroom. Sure, she recognised a lot of the furniture, but the layout was different and the room was a lot smaller. The one thing that really stood out was how tidy it was - usually the only way the floor was usually clean in Rose's room was when the maid came in and gutted it once a week and left it pristine, only for Rose to mess it up in a few hours by dropping clothes and accessories all over it as she tried on a number of outfits.

No, this room had been tidied recently, and not by the maid. Things weren't put away exactly as they should, but whoever had tidied had at least tried. Stuffed toys that Rose never remembered owning were overflowing in a basked by her regal armchair, which had relatively neatly folded clothes on. There were flat pack sets sticking out from behind her open door, a few boxes piled up between them an her dresser that seemed oddly make up free.

Rose struggled out of bed, waddling over to the full length mirror on the bathroom door, eyes half-closed, as part of her wasn't ready for the sight she was about to see.

She took a deep breath and opened her eyes and screamed at her reflection.

Gone was the beautiful girl she'd been what felt like only hours ago. In her place was a chubby (and very pregnant) teenager. Her once luscious red locks were now dull and slightly greasy, as if they hadn't been washed in a while and were pulled into a tight but messy ponytail on the top of her head. Her once model-like cheekbones had disappeared under fat, replaced with two chubby cheeks and the makings of a double chin. Her skin was 'glowing' with one or two zits dotted on her cheeks and chin, something she'd never had to deal with before, and as soon as she noticed them her face felt itchy, a need to scratch and pop them coming over her. The only feature that was left unscathed were her pouty lips - the rest of her face looking like she'd thrown out her skincare routine months ago with a dash of crazy hormones.

As her eyes travelled down her body, Rose saw that she overall seemed wider and her arms felt heavier and thicker under the plaid material of the shirt. Her shoulders were broader, with her chest almost bursting out of her top as her sensitive nipples moved against the restrictive material. Her belly seemed to be carrying most of her new girth though, sticking out in front of her like a beach ball. Rose's chubby fingers moved to touch it, feeling an initial softness that gave way to a hardness under the thick layer of fat. If she didn't know any better, Rose would think she was pregnant.

As soon as that thought entered her mind, she felt something inside her move, the shock of it unsteadying her a little before she managed to catch herself.

"No." She gasped as she shook her head. "This can't be happening."

She stumbled back again a few steps her footing heavier than she remembered underneath her on the plush carpet as her thick thighs rubbed together. This was yet another totally alien feeling for Rose as she'd always been proud of her thigh-gap. Suddenly a pair of arms wrapped around her, catching her before she stumbled anymore, slowly guiding her to the end of the bed.

When she opened her eyes, she was shocked to see that it was one of the guys she'd slept with months ago. He was a little older if she remembered correctly, and a little dull, but she'd been able to look past his lack of personality (and his chubby frame) because she knew he had money and she'd never have to see him again. Clearly she'd been wrong on that front. He looked almost the same only now he had a five o'clock shadow and looked a little more dishevelled with a little more weight around his middle.

"Are you okay, sweetheart?" He asked.

She pushed him away. "What the HELL are you doing here?" She yelled, losing her balance and almost sliding off the bed, still not used to her her girth.

He steadied her once more, looking at her confused. "What do you mean baby, I've lived here for the past few months, since you found out you were pregnant." He put his hand on Rose's knee, and that's when she sees the wedding band on his left hand. She immediately looked at her own left hand and was relieved to not be wearing any rings, sighing with relief.

"It's okay, I put it in a safe place, remember?" He cooed as he made his way over to the nearest nightstand, rummaging in it. That's when Rose noticed the two frames on top.

The first picture was of two people in a registry office. She couldn't make them out, but from what she could see the bride and groom were a little chubby, a significant bump sticking out of a beachy maxidress on the bride while the guy was in an ill-fitting shirt and khakis. The second picture was also black and white. It was a baby scan.

Rose's eyes went wide as the guy...Cameron? Was that his name? pulled out a small pouch, bringing it over to her.

"See, there's your ring..." he pulled out a simple looking wedding band that matched his.

Rose whacked his hand away and the ring went flying. "I am NOT your wife!" She shouted, stopping herself from moving so she didn't need his help again.

He sighed. "I know the baby wasn't planned. Hell, we both freaked out when you found out you were pregnant, but we've been making it work. We got to know each other and fell in love and got married so we could be a family."

The memories replayed in her head that matched up with what he was saying. His name was Cameron Waverly, the only son of one of his father's friends. When she found out she was pregnant she'd freaked out and planned to get rid of the baby, thinking she was too young but had bumped into Cameron on the way to the appointment. She'd told him she was pregnant and what she was about to do, but he'd managed to persuade her to think about it a bit more. He'd taken her to a local diner and they'd gotten to know each other.

As their love grew, so did their waistlines (Rose's in particular) and as Rose's pregnancy went on she rapidly outgrew clothes. Most days she cried as she discovered a new stretchmark, or when she couldn't fit in her clothes anymore, even though she'd bought them only a week ago, and when she had one of her 'fat' days. Each time, Cameron was at her side, telling her she was beautiful and that he loved her.

When they couldn't hide the pregnancy or their relationship any longer, they moved into the Waverly guesthouse where they lived in their own little world. Cameron went off to work at his dad's company a few times a week while studying for his degree, while Rose nested and nibbled. When she got to six months pregnant, they'd decided to get married and start their happy every after.

Now at seven months pregnant and having gained almost 70lbs, Rose had started to feel more insecure, so Cameron worked from home in the study that would later become their baby's room.

"Cameron?" She whimpered, cupping his face as tears fell down her face.

"Yes, baby?" He mumbled back, kissing the palm of her hand.

"I love you."

He smiled "I love you too."

The couple embraced, but there was something niggling at the back of Rose's head. Part of her was so sure this was what her life was now, while the other part was screaming at her that this hadn't been the case a few hours ago.

Something wasn't right, and she knew she had to figure out what was real, and what wasn't.

Just then, the baby inside her kicked...

The whole estate was in Winchester Cove, a small fishing village in New England right on the shore of the Atlantic Ocean. Several generations of Rose's family had lived in the manor, and it was without doubt the biggest house in town, complete with its own gates, its own security, several luxury cars, a pool, and all the bells and whistles of a lifestyle fit for those who never had to worry about money because they'd always had plenty of it.

What she saw was a great big package wrapped up in what seemed to be plain brown paper covered with dust. "What the hell is this . . . " Rose mused as she reached behind the couch, grabbed the top of the dusty old thing, and pulled it out.


A small cloud of dust emerged from the item's resting place as she removed it. She took it with both hands and guided it into the light. After a few seconds, Rose removed the last of the paper and looked upon an old painting seeming to depict a woman from another time, another world even.
